ul.li1: 1Hear this, house of Jacob,
who are called by the name of Israel
ul.li2: and came out from the waters of Judah,
ul.li1: who swear by the name of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and invokeLiterally “cause to remember” the God of Israel,
ul.li1: but not in truth
ul.li2: and not in righteousness.
ul.li1: 2For they call themselves after the holy city,Literally “from the city of the holiness”
ul.li2: and they lean on the God of Israel—
ul.li3: Yahweh of hosts is his name.
ul.li1: 3“I declared the former things from of old,Literally “then”
ul.li2: and they went out from my mouth.
ul.li1: And I announcedLiterally “caused to hear” them suddenly;
ul.li2: I acted,Or “did” and they came to pass,
ul.li1: 4because I knowLiterally “knowing me” that you are obstinate,
ul.li2: and your neck an iron sinew,
and your forehead bronze.
ul.li1: 5And I declared them to you from of old;
ul.li2: I announcedLiterally “caused to hear” them to you before they came to pass
ul.li1: so that you would not say, ‘My idol did them,
ul.li2: and my image and my cast image commanded them.’
ul.li1: 6You have heard; see it all.
ul.li2: And will you not declare it?
ul.li1: I announceLiterally “cause to hear” new things to you from this time
ul.li2: and hidden things thatOr “and” you have not known.
ul.li1: 7Now they are created, and not from of old,Literally “then”
ul.li2: and before today, and you have not heard them
ul.li3: so that you could not say, “Look! I knew them.”
ul.li1: 8Neither have you heard, nor have you known,
ul.li2: nor from of oldLiterally “then” has your ear been opened.
ul.li1: For I knew you would deal treacherously, very treacherously,
ul.li2: and you are called a rebel from the womb.
ul.li1: 9For the sake of my name I refrain fromLiterally “make long” my anger,
ul.li2: and for my praise I restrain it for you
ul.li3: so as not to cut you off.
ul.li1: 10Look! I have refined you, butOr “and” not likeOr “with” silver;
ul.li2: I have chosen you in the furnace of misery.
ul.li1: 11For my own sake, for my own sake I do it;
ul.li2: for why should itThat is, my name be defiled?
ul.li3: And I will not give my glory to another.”

ul.li1: 12“Listen to me, Jacob,
ul.li2: and Israel, whom I called:Literally “who was called by me”
ul.li1: I am he. I am the first;
ul.li2: also I am the last.
ul.li1: 13Indeed, my hand founded the earth,
ul.li2: and my right hand spread out the heavens;
ul.li3: when I summonOr “calling” them, they stand in position together.
ul.li1: 14Assemble, all of you, and hear!
ul.li2: Who among them declared these things?
ul.li1: Yahweh loves him;
ul.li2: he shall performOr “do” his wish against Babylon
and his arm against the Chaldeans.Literally “Chaldea”
ul.li1: 15I, I myself, I have spoken!
ul.li2: Indeed, I have called him.
ul.li1: I have brought him,
ul.li2: and he will be successful in his way.
ul.li1: 16Draw near to me; hear this! I have not spoken in secrecy from the beginning;Literally “head”
ul.li2: from the time it came to be,Literally “of becoming it” there I have been;
ul.li3: And now the Lord Yahweh has sent me and his Spirit.”

chapter.p: 17Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer, the holy one of Israel:

ul.li1: “I am Yahweh your God, who teachesLiterally “teaching” you to profit,
ul.li2: leads you in the way you should go.

chapter.p: 18O that you had listened attentively to my commandments!

ul.li1: ThenOr “and” your prosperity would have been like a river,
ul.li2: and your righteousness like the waves of the sea.
ul.li1: 19And your offspring would have been like the sand,
ul.li2: and the descendants of your bodyLiterally “intestines” like its grains.Hebrew “grain”
ul.li1: It would not be cut off,
ul.li2: and its name would not be destroyed from my presence.”
ul.li1: 20Go out from Babylon!
ul.li2: Flee from Chaldea!
ul.li1: ProclaimOr “announce” it with a shoutOr “sound” of rejoicing; proclaimOr “cause to hear” this!
ul.li2: Send it forthLiterally “Cause it to go out” to the end of the earth;
ul.li3: say, “Yahweh has redeemed his servant Jacob!”
ul.li1: 21And when he led them through the deserts, they were not thirsty;
ul.li2: he made water flow from the rock for them,
ul.li1: and he split the rock,
ul.li2: and the water gushed out.

chapter.p: 22“There is no peace,” says Yahweh, “for the wicked.”
